Title: Colophon
Medium: ink and pigments on laid paper
Inscriptions: [Transliteration] tammat [sic] al-kitāb bi-'awni Allāhi al-maliki al-wahhāb wa-sallá Allāh /1/ 'alá khayr khalqih Muhammad wa-ālihi ajma'in wa-al-hamd li-Llāhi /2/ rabbi al-'ālamīn fī ta<'>rīkh salkhi /3/ Safar khutima [sic] bi-al-khayr wa-al-zafar /4/ sanat 946 /5/ m [=tamma] m [=tamma] m [=tamma] /6/
Description: This folio from Walters manuscript W.631 contains a colophon in partly vocalized Arabic in the shape of a triangle. The colophon gives the date of copying.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Colophon; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Miniature; Painting; Contemporary Binding; Iran; Fortune-telling; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Hafiz (Persian, flourished 8th century AH/AD 14th century)
